title: Love Island Australia host Sophie Monk quashes rumours she's the hit Channel 10
text:
Sophie Monk is set to host the highly-anticipated second season of Love Island Australia on Channel Nine.

But that hasn't stopped fans of the blonde bombshell, 39, from believing she is on Channel 10's The Masked Singer.

Speaking to the Kyle and Jackie O show, on Friday, she said: 'People dead set think I'm on the Masked Singer.'

'People dead set think I'm on the Masked Singer!' Love Island Australia host Sophie Monk set the record straight on speculation she's the Unicorn on the hit Channel 10 show

She added: 'Every interview I'm doing, talking about Love Island, they're like "we know you're on the Masked Singer".

'A lot of people are guessing you Soph,' Jackie 'O' Henderson chimed in.

Kyle said: 'Don't they realise you're on a different channel?'

Who's that girl? Sophie keeps being accused of being the Unicorn on The Masked Singer

Jackie went on to ask what character people were guessing her as the most.

'Is it the Unicorn? Because it had Bachelorette clues, girl band clues - it really added up to be you,' she said.

Kyle added, 'Well who else could it possibly be with those clues?'

Is it her? Sophie guessed the likely candidate for the Unicorn was season two Bachelorette Georgia Love (pictured), who is currently a reporter and personality for Channel 10

Sophie guessed the likely candidate for the Unicorn was season two Bachelorette Georgia Love, who is currently a reporter and personality for Channel 10

The former Bardot band member recently jetted off to Fiji, where Love Island will be filmed, with boyfriend Joshua Gross.

The couple first met on a flight from Europe to Australia last August, and shared a kiss after enjoying 'three champagnes' in business class.

Love Island Australia premieres Monday, October 7 at 8.45pm on Channel Nine
description: Sophie Monk is set to host the highly-anticipated second season of Love Island Australia on Channel Nine.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
